p: The MaxEnt models based on the RCP 2.6 emission scenarios for the potential distribution of A. yasumatsui in 2050 are presented in Fig. 3A and Table 2. The potential area of invasion with suitable habitat was 40,077,550 km 2, which represents an shrink of 13.6% over the current area of suitable habitat. The area of highly suitable habitat expand to 2,734,675 km 2 (an increase of approximately 14.3% over the current highly suitable area).
